medical_history.chief_complaint: Vision deterioration due to retinal degeneration
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In case 1, vision began to deteriorate at age 31 with an initial vision of 0.7 in the right eye and 0.3 in the left eye. Over 23 years, clumped pigmentation appeared, and cystic changes in the fovea became ambiguous, leading to a final vision of 0.5 in the right eye and 0.3 in the left at age 53. In case 2, a 78-year-old woman showed mild retinal degeneration with no pigmentation and an improvement in vision to 0.3 in the right eye and 0.2 in the left after cataract surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Enhanced S-cone syndrome (ESCS) characterized by night blindness and sensitivity to short-wavelength light, revealing genetic mutations in the NR2E3 gene.
medical_history.family_history: A daughter of case 2 was an asymptomatic carrier of the p.R48C mutation but had normal fundus appearance.
